item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, February 28, 2025 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. macOS Tips and Tricks (2022) (124 points | 42 comments)
2. GPT-4.5 (794 points | 607 comments)
3. IBM completes acquisition of HashiCorp (283 points | 177 comments)
4. Fire-Flyer File System from DeepSeek (90 points | 15 comments)

6. Type 1 diabetes reversed by new cell transplantation technique (155 points | 28 comments)
7. Markov Chains Explained Visually (2014) (70 points | 6 comments)
8. Turning a Bluetooth device into an Apple AirTag without root privileges (384 points | 68 comments)
9. Spotify's Beta Used 'Pirate' MP3 Files, Some from Pirate Bay (37 points | 18 comments)
10. World-first experimental cancer treatment paves way for clinical trial (99 points | 27 comments)
11. EA Open Sources Command and Conquer: Red Alert, along with other games (786 points | 214 comments)
12. There isn't much point to HTTP/2 past the load balancer (258 points | 193 comments)
13. Solitaire (403 points | 123 comments)
14. US authorities can see more than ever, with Big Tech as their eyes (24 points | 4 comments)
15. Nvidia emulation journey, part 1: RIVA 128/NV3 architecture history and overview (96 points | 26 comments)
16. Hydrogen cyanide and acetylene detected in a brown dwarf (10 points | 4 comments)
17. Doc NTIA lead nominee criticizes "woke" and "socialist" fiber broadband subsidy (18 points | 22 comments)
18. Postgres as a Graph Database: (Ab)Using PgRouting (98 points | 22 comments)
19. A $100 DIY muon tomographer (243 points | 34 comments)
20. Speed or security? Speculative execution in Apple Silicon (3 points | 1 comment)
21. Show HN: Python micro event loop library (~250 LOC) (18 points | discuss)
22. Launch HN: Bild AI (YC W25) – Understand Construction Blueprints Using AI (73 points | 29 comments)
23. Kastle (YC S24) Is Hiring – AI for Loan Servicing ( | hide)
24. Putting Andrew Ng's OCR models to the test (6 points | 3 comments)
25. The Great Re-shard: adding Postgres capacity (again) with zero downtime (2023) (15 points | discuss)
26. A data analysis of speeches at the Oscars (137 points | 14 comments)
27. Mozilla owns "information you input through Firefox" (250 points | 141 comments)
28. What can be computed? A practical guide to the theory of computation (2018) [pdf] (69 points | 3 comments)
29. Show HN: Probly – Spreadsheets, Python, and AI in the browser (135 points | 26 comments)
30. Show HN: Superglue – open source API connector that writes its own code (143 points | 39 comments)
